title: Player admits to board smurfing
body:
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/VFfFjcV7-to-aerowaffle-please-read-this-message-is-for-you

Was pretty obvious when this account came out of nowhere and just randomly starts posting multiple threads per hour sometimes, and targeting a certain individual. Posting this here because, to be quite blunt, I don't have time to wait hours in the discord for a response when multiple moderators are active on the boards and/or on Discord, yet simply can't take a simple thread link and take an action that should take 5 seconds.

I get that moderators are overworked - but the response time on the Discord which is advertised for "urgent" issues is too high. Riot should give you guys the tools to either make people want to work more, or more moderation "budget"/time so that you can have more moderators.

replies.body: Currently working on some improved tools. It has been a while since we had moderator recruitment, though, so that's not completely off the table either.

Also, harassment on these boards is a big issue, If you could develop a feature that allows us to block certain people from veiwing and commenting on our posts that would be greatly appreciated.  I just had An issue with a player going to all of my post harassing me so I felt the need to delete all the post he was in just so he would stop harassing me, Reporting doesn't solve issue with toxic harassment, all moderators do is delete your comment, but that same person can still view and comment on our posts. So In the interest of getting him to stop harassing me I contact him and threatened to harass him on his posts if he didn't stop. He replied "making online threats gets you no where", this guy knows he can do and say what he wants and nothing will happen, And ofcaorse because I deleted all my posts he was on, the only thing that showed up was me harassing him after I told him Id harass him if he continued. He reported my attempt to confront him, I got contacted by moderators and the comments of me confronting my bully got deleted and Moderators threatened to punish me further if my actions continued, so not only does reporting not stop harassment, but when we confront our harassers, moderators see it as us threatening them, which it is a threat I don't deny that, but we get in trouble for protecting ourselves. We can report if we are feeling harassed all we want but if a moderator doesn't feel like the comment is harassing whether we the player feels harassed or not, nothing happens. All of these issues im having with trying to protect myself from harassment, are solved if you guys develop a feature that allows us to create a block list, and those on the block list cant view or comment on our posts. I bet with a system like that in place, most of all the issues of toxicity on this website go bye bye. This website is way more toxic then the actual game is, and you see the number of players complaining about the games toxicity...

Its just odd to me how you are flocking to the defense of someone who was harassing me. says a lot about your character.

If im shoving your head in the toilet everyday, and you tell your teachers about it and they do nothing, are you just going to take it? or you going to fight back? I decided to fight back, I asked moderators for help, they decided to look at my profile and his and said he did nothing wrong instead of believing me. I would post, and he was follow each and every post knowing I didn't want him on my posts. All im asking for from them is for them to create a system that allows us to block people, but instead of seeing my message for what it is you attack me. says a lot about your character.

Had you not come to this thread with your claim I wouldn't have even bothered looking into it. If you don't want people to comment on the situation you didn't have to post.

But its had nothing to do with you? and for reasons just like this, people sticking there nose into something that has nothing to do with them, I shouldn't have to convince you im telling the truth, I already admitted I harassed him in retaliation but you are hard stuck on believing other wise. does what you think matter? Here im asking you about the topic I discussed on being able to block persons who harass, but instead of being on that topic you would rather be toxic and argue with me to be right about something that has nothing to do with you. With this feature I'd block you, and you would never see me or another one of my posts ever again. and guess what? we do not argue as a result of it. its like you WANT to fight and argue... when I do not. What I want is a non toxic environment, I'm tired of it, and that's also part of the reason I decided to harass back, because im tired of it, league of legends boards is all toxic, i can't even type to a board dev without being flamed by people like you wanting to be right about something. I already told you i admitted to harassing him in retaliation, if you continue to flame me over it im reporting you for harassment. I do not want to argue, I want you to leave me tf alone.

You don't get to choose what content other people see. If you want to block someone, that's fine (you can do this with BEK), but you'll only be blocking you from seeing their posts. You don't get to change what **they** see. They have the same right to discussion as everyone else as long as they are not breaking the rules. No matter how much you dislike their opinion.

You are talking about the system that is already in place, i've talked this through with the moderators already, You telling me this means nothing because what I was asking has nothing to do with the system already in place, Im asking for them to create a system to block people from seeing profiles, post and comments. That features alone stop conversations like this meanless conversation from ever taking place, and the community would be less toxic because of it.

If someone is using post history to harass you, report them (since that **IS** against the rules). But using post history to point out a lie or point how much was downplayed in the story that is directly related to a comment is fair game.

Just like how pointing out someone's match history to ridicule them is against the rules but it's fine to point out that they were lying when they make a claim related to their match history.

Just because you don't like it when someone uses a person's own words as proof for counter arguments doesn't mean that the boards should protect your poor arguments from that.

Edit:
Oh yeah, and this block feature wouldn't even work now that I think about it. All they would need to do is log out to see your profile. Or simply log into another account. The people whom would abuse the post history feature to harass someone is also someone who would likely have multiple accounts. Such people often use mutliple accounts to upvote/downvote when they feel like their opinion is more important than others as well.

Look. This is a public board. Your comments and posts are available to the public to offer their opinion on. If you feel like I'm breaking the rules you're free to report me, but you don't get to dictate who is or is not allowed to comment on your posts.

If the person commenting on your posts are following the rules and remaining on topic they are allowed to comment wherever they please. You're free to disagree with them, counter their argument, or ignore them. But you don't get to exclude them.

Hey, so I'm going to make an identical post to you on Discord, but BEK actually does have the ability to block you from seeing other users' posts. Just use one of those links for whatever browser you have, and it'll download an extension to your browser: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/U8uw8k1l-04-boards-enhancement-kit-may-7

That being said, I will be evaluating some of this content on this discussion. If you do have concerns on the boards unrelated to this post (regarding smurfs) you should just make your own discussion.

This user Aero, also proves another point, people being able to view our history and post, only creates toxicity, And we the users have no way of protecting ourselves from these kinds of attacks.  Why does the system in place allow for all of this negativity? I honestly just want it to stop, No more moderators deciding whether we continue to be harassed or not, We the players should be given the controls for who we allow onto our board post discussions, who can view our profile, who we block ect. As you can see I post a concern and this summoner jumps at the opportunity to flame me and be right about something. I'm not denying that I harassed in retaliation, I got fed up and reacted. But these conversations with people I'm not friends with, able to view my profile and dig up dirt on my history, what makes sense about that?  and now that him and I disagree on something, what stops him from harassing me in my future post? Once people decide they dont like someone its a wrap, everything that person says or does will be attacked. Like How I told him I retaliated by harassing the guy who harassed me, his responce, "oh you are just the bully playing the victim" as if Im mad and harassing this guy because he did nothing to me, If I had the ability to block Aero, these toxic environments do not take place.
"Boards smurfing" is not against the rules.
It is when a boards banned player keeps violating the rules on a new account. That is clearly what’s happening here.
I mean yeah that would be against the rules but "smurfing" on boards in itself is not.
True. I should've made more clear that when I said "smurf" I meant using another account *to violate the rules* - not simply using another account.

The term used in the Universal Board Rules [[here]](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE) is "Evading Board Bans" 

>Do not use alternate accounts to post rule-breaking content if you have an account serving a Boards suspension. Do not post rule-breaking content on behalf of an individual serving a Boards suspension.

> I don't have time to wait hours in the discord for a response when multiple moderators are active on the boards and/or on Discord

Just because someone is shown as "Online" in our server doesn't mean they're actively and exclusively watching the server and waiting for someone to show up. I myself use Discord for **numerous** different things, not just for modding, and I'm sure this applies to pretty much the majority of the team.

I fully understand this. I was referring to moderators who are participating in discussions in the #off-topic channel in the boards discord, and/or posting on the boards at the time. Not simply being "online" on discord.

Forgive me for the edit, but I'd also like to ask (probably a herald response needed): **What is an "acceptable" response time to an urgent issue?** Is it 30 minutes? Is it 2 hours?

Let's say, for example, that there was a board-breaking issue that I had evidence of and needed to give the moderators. Let's say someone's posting veiled pornography that likely wouldn't be seen by your moderator passing by. What is the acceptable amount of time that a response to someone in the Discord should go unanswered?

Whatever that time is, unless you're saying that it's okay to leave things like that unanswered for 12+ hours, then it's not being met and moderators need to be recruited that can cover time gaps.

I'm pretty sure I've waited in Discord for several hours without getting an answer, yeah. The mods aren't paid, and they don't treat moderation as a job... not even a volunteer job. It's a hobby they do for fun, because they like LoL. I've requested that they post their irregular, for-fun hours of operation and been met with scorn, even though all I wanted was to be able to look at the Discord and know that no one will be there today so I don't need to waste my time sitting in front of my computer waiting for a response (because if you step away for five minutes and they respond in that time, they leave and you missed your opportunity). I've found it a bit less stressful to use the "message-staff" channel, which just sends a message rather than going for a live conversation. Of course, sometimes I ping a mod and get an immediate response. It's like a box of chocolates.

But what do you expect when not even Riot treats Boards as their job? It's just a place they go to when they want to see some gushing praise for their Story, Art, & Sound (which they sometimes outsource anyway).

The best thing for a regular user to do _for the sake of your own sanity_ is to report any issues you see (with the built-in report feature) and leave it at that. The next best thing is to use the message-staff channel when you see something that hasn't been handled for a while and you can't leave it alone. After that is pinging a mod to have a live chat with "look at all these trash threads you gotta remove" and then you can hopefully both have a laugh about all the trash. After _that_ is arguing with the mods over a moderation action/inaction/policy you disagree with, because everyone already has their own opinion on Boards policies and you have about as much chance of changing someone's mind about that here as you do of changing someone's mind about politics on Facebook.

TL;DR: Try not to care too much.

I've complained about this. It's not a hobby. It is a job. A volunteer job is **still a job**. There is no other volunteer job where any semblance of accountability is discounted under "it's just volunteer". The bar for competence and professionalism should not be lower simply because they're volunteers - but it is.

If the current moderators are unable to meet higher bars, **then they shouldn't be picked to be moderators**. If they balk at having set time requirements, **they should not be moderators**. If they don't understand that it's not appropriate to "meme" at a user with a serious concern about an action, **they should not be moderators**. It does not matter that they're volunteers - at this point they're basically some anarchist militia with no oversight because any oversight would infringe on them being "volunteers".

It honestly pisses me off because I've seen forums do this exact thing before, and been a part of teams that refuse to have oversight and go to shit because of it. Unfortunately, none of the heralds have the guts to stand up to the others and actually make changes to make this volunteer job actually have standards. The heralds are all okay with "no time requirements" because **they themselves would be burdened by them**. They are fine with "not being professionals" because they themselves don't want to worry about being professional when they're posting/talking *as a moderator*. They are fine with "it's okay to reply to a boards user with 'lol' instead of a substantive response" because **their friend was the one who did it**.

To be quite blunt, and I know there's no chance in hell that this happens, **the heralds need to step up and lead the moderators**. Period. If they're unwilling to step up, set policies/procedures, and make a moderation team that works, then they need replaced. I get that many of them have been in the moderation team forever. That does not excuse this lack of effort and lack of professionalism from the team. **Yes, that means some moderators/volunteers will need 'fired'**. There's at least two moderators now that should have been fired long ago given unprofessional responses to boards users. **Volunteer does not mean unprofessional** - unless you're this herald team, in which case it means "whatever we want it to mean".

Think about it - if implementing time requirements would leave you with “zero volunteer moderators” then you guys aren’t onboarding the right people. Plenty of volunteer organizations work while requiring a minimum time commitment and booting those who don’t meet it. Why can’t this one?
